results.title: Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
results.description:
At Bluesight, our mission is to create groundbreaking medication intelligence solutions that increase efficiency, safety and visibility for health systems and pharmaceutical manufacturers.  We empower our customers to deliver the right medicine to the right patient at the right time, every time.  We are a high growth healthcare software technology company with a start-up 'vibe' but over 1000 customers tracking medications using our proven and established solutions.

Kit Check is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to help us redefine what healthcare software can do. Our hundreds of customers rely on us to keep their patients safe and their pharmacies running smoothly while delighting them with every release.

As an SDET you won’t just be clicking on buttons, but diving into the application from the frontend to the backend to the database. We automate most of our end-to-end test cases with Cypress in a continuous integration environment. Not only that, but we have an internet of things where you will be diving into scanning stations, RFID tags, databases, and raw data analysis. Here at Kit Check, we work with a small, tightly-knit team where you have the opportunity to wear many hats and grow in a myriad of directions. This is a collaborative job where we work across the board with dev, product, and customer success to better the product as a whole.


What you will do:
  • Define and drive automation, performance (load, stress, capacity), exploratory, API, and regression testing strategies with innovative tooling for our overall development processes that support and enhance quality assurance within the organization.
  • Establish performance quality goals/metrics from scratch to drive continuous improvement and provide guidance for automation framework enhancement to support continuous testing and delivery.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to help define current and future system performance testing requirements to achieve the highest testing standard.
  • Professional attitude, leading by example, driven and passionate about software quality, agile methodologies, and a strong advocate for improving SDLC / STLC processes.
  • Create SQL queries for database validation and write REST API automation scripts.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and engineers to perform root-cause analysis and preliminary problem diagnosis, identify and track defects in JIRA with detailed steps to reproduce.
  • Build tools to assist with test automation, functional, load / performance testing efforts and assist with innovating existing automation processes.
  • Design and build end-to-end automation tests, and maintain regression testing suite by updating test cases in TestRail to include newly added functionality. 
  • Participate in backlog refinement/sprint planning and work with stakeholders to identify risks and impacts to the application. 
  • Independently own a workstream, develop scripts, utilities, simulators, data sets, and other programmatic test tools as required for test automation and manual testing as needed.


Qualifications:
  • Minimum six (6) years of QA automation and Performance (Load, Scalability, and Stress) testing experience in an Agile engineering environment
  • Experience with JMeter is highly preferred
  • Experience defining, building, and maintaining automated test frameworks for unit/integration / end-to-end testing
  • Experience with automated build and source/version control tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins, Github, or equivalent
  • Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and Agile based testing, including peer review, test automation, and continuous integration
  • Experience working with languages/frameworks including Java, Python, SQL, Postman, Cypress, Karate, Angular, and React
  • Experience with troubleshooting performance-related technical issues and strategizing performance tests for large or distributed product ecosystems
  • Strong experience with CI/CD, test-driven, and BDD methodologies
  • Solid written and verbal communication skills
The standard base pay range for this role is $105,000 - $125,000. In addition to a base salary, this position is also eligible for an amazing benefits package. The actual amount of salary varies depending on experience, performance, and location.

This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States.

Why Bluesight?
Bluesight’s culture is built on innovation and teamwork. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun doing it.  We truly believe that where you work and what you do matters.  Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape!
-Competitive salary
-Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days!
-Generous insurance coverage
-401k program with a company match
-Employee stock options
-Fun, collaborative culture!

EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Junior QA Engineer
results.description:
Apriorit is a software engineering company, which was established in 2002, and has extensive experience in system programming, cybersecurity, reverse engineering, SaaS/web, blockchain-based solutions, and artificial intelligence. 

Working with high-profile clients (including Fortune 500 companies) for 20+ years, we have established high standards in software development, communication, and effective teamwork. 

Our headquarters are in the US, with EU offices in Budapest and Poland and three R&D offices in Ukraine. Our team consists of over 350 specialists, and we assist tech companies around the world to turn their challenging ideas into secure and viable products.  

We are currently looking for a Junior QA Engineer who is an advanced user of Windows and Linux OSs, and wants to develop themselves in a QA career.  

  

Job description 

Our client is one of the market leaders in backup and data recovery for Windows and Linux OSs. The product covers the full spectrum of business challenges, from file sync and share, to backup and disaster recovery. 

You will work on an interesting project with a diverse technology stack in an experienced team. We guarantee mentoring support and professional growth, and with us you can become a QA expert very quickly. 

  

Key responsibilities: 

  • Confirmation and regression testing after feature implementation / bug fixing 
  • Acceptance testing 
  • Investigating automation failures   
  • Preparing test documentation  

  

Skills and experience: 

  • 6+ months testing experience 
  • Advanced user of Linux OS (Ubuntu, RedHat, Debian) 
  • Advanced user of Windows OS 
  • English language level: Pre-Intermediate or higher 
  • Good knowledge of testing theory   
     

Nice to have: 

  • Understanding of Active Directory, DHCP, network routing  
  • Knowledge and experience with VMware/VirtualBox/Hyper-V  
     

Perks & benefits:  

  • Career development 
  • Tutoring support 
  • Professional colleagues 
  • Friendly working atmosphere 
  • Remote work or in office (optional) 
  • Paid vacation and sick leave 
  • Medical insurance or compensation for sports  
  • Equipment provided (laptop, monitor, accessories)  
  • Free corporate English lessons with a native speaker  

  

If you are interested in this position, please send us your detailed CV.  

Apriorit – A Priority Choice!

results.title: QA Engineer
results.description:
Punchbowl is looking for a QA Engineer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate has 1-3+ years of experience in software quality assurance. As a hands-on QA engineer for Punchbowl.com, Memento.com, and our mobile apps, you will build a deep knowledge of our platform and products, draft and execute test plans, advance our automation efforts, and ensure all new code is tested with minimal risk of causing site downtime.

You will:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to run and perfect the release process
  • Manage processes for testing & communicating feedback to the dev team
  • Oversee the development and maintenance of test plans for all active products
  • Develop test cases for planned features and ensure full test coverage of the product spec
  • Work closely with the customer support team to identify user-facing and user-reported issues
  • Establish new processes earlier in the development lifecycle to help our QA process “shift left”
  • Evangelize and implement end-to-end regression testing with a framework like Cypress or Playwright to improve our testing automation suite
  • Prioritize and escalate live issues appropriately

Requirements

  • Passionate and opinionated about delivering flawless products (web and app)
  • Experienced with software quality assurance (1-3+ years) and different testing techniques
  • An exceptional communicator who knows how to write clear, precise feedback for developers
  • Knowledgeable about how to build processes and evangelize them within an organization
  • A problem-solving savant with impeccable attention to detail

Benefits

Do you want to work in a growing company that invests in its employees more than the average company? Punchbowl is the company behind the critically-acclaimed technology platform for celebrations, holidays, and meaningful life memories. The Company runs its platform on Punchbowl.com, Memento.com, and best-in-class iOS and Android apps. We provide a fun, casual, and innovative environment where hard work is recognized and rewarded.

Some Punchbowl Perks:

  • 100% healthcare coverage
  • Flexibility to work from wherever you will be most effective
  • A collaborative, start-up environment where you’ll learn a lot, get your hands dirty, and see your work directly impact our customers
  • Fantastic, smart coworkers who are passionate about what they do
  • Virtual team coffee chats, Friday team trivia challenges, and anything else we can think of to have fun as a team from a distance

 

PLEASE NOTE: Our team is primarily based in Framingham, MA and London, ON. We will consider applicants who reside anywhere in the United States or Canada who are willing to work “East Coast Hours” (roughly 9am-5:30pm EST).

results.title: Senior Engineer in Test
results.description:
ABOUT KATMAI

Katmai is a 3D video conferencing platform that brings people together in unprecedented ways. Welcome to a better way to connect, collaborate, and feel like a team again - all within a branded virtual world built for you.

The Katmai team spans from Alaska to The Netherlands, making stops along the way. We are a fully remote team that works inside our own virtual office product; call us biased, but we think it is awesome.

WHY ARE WE DOING THIS?

Katmai was created to improve the quality of collaborating remotely. Our technology brings new life to work, play, and socializing over video and audio on your computer. We have created immersive technology that gets us one step closer to feeling like we’re in-person.

LIFE AT KATMAI

Help build the future of remote work while experiencing it in real-time.

Our primary time zone is EST, but we have found a pulse to accommodate the 10 hours of time zones that we currently span. Jobs at Katmai are fully remote, and our future off-site plans are continually evolving. At Katmai, everyone has a voice. We work in cross-functional teams, in an Agile environment.

We work inside of the Katmai Virtual Office.

WHAT WE'RE SEEKING

Katmai is a web-based 3D video conferencing platform for remote work, events and all else metaverse. It runs on the Katmai Engine, which provides graphics, networking, audio, video, physics and more.  We are looking for a Senior Engineer in Test to build our testing team from the group up. 

As a Senior Engineer in Test you will work with the other engineering teams to define and build testing strategies and frameworks for performance, integration, and end-to-end tests. Additionally you will collaborate with the product and customer success teams to automate system compatibility, UAT, and regression tests. Unit tests are generally the responsibility of the teams writing the code to be tested.

WHAT YOU BRING

We are looking for a candidate with an established history of complex and thorough testing experience. Generally, someone with 5+ years of experience with the following skills:

Technical Skills

  • You can have experience defining efficient test matrices
  • You have a solid understanding of various testing frameworks and libraries
  • You are as comfortable writing performance tests as user workflow tests
  • You can integrate tests into automated CI/CD pipelines

Communication

  • You can explain the tradeoffs you’ve made in your decision making
  • You proactively seek the information, tools, or help you need from others
  • You can document test plans and results in away accessible to technical and non-technical folk
  • You are good at figuring out the underlying need for an underdefined problem, and can identify and work with stakeholders from across the company

Leadership

  • You help others with specific, constructive feedback for code, and design.
  • You can identify areas of process or communication that need to be improved across the teams you work with
  • You establish direction for the team and help guide automated testing strategies.

Note that in this job description we describe the ideal candidate. If you don’t fully match all of it but are willing to grow, we invite you to apply. We also would like you to apply if you feel you can add diversity to our team. Katmai Tech Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

 

Katmai is a fully remote company currently hiring in the United States and Canada.   The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are based on your job-related skills and experience and by location.   Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations and refers to the amount Katmai is willing to pay at the time of this posting.  The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future

  • Location is United States: USD $95,000 and USD $150,000 for a Sr. Engineer in Test
  • Location is Canada:   C$80,000 and C$120,000 for a Sr. Engineer in Test

 

Benefits

Katmai is committed to offering a comprehensive portfolio of employee benefits designed to support the health and wellbeing of you and your family. Benefits vary by location and include:

  • 100% Company Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
  • Vacation, Sick Leave, and Holiday Pay
  • Short-term Disability and Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • 100% Remote Work

results.title: Senior QA Test Automation Engineer
results.description:
Description

We are ElectroNeek

ElectroNeek empowers IT Service Providers to bring complex Hyperautomation technologies to 200M+ small and medium-size clients with no-code tools, partner-centric support, and disruptive business models. With customers ranging from boutiques and newcomers in the automation-as-a-service industry to established market players like Xerox, Compasso, and Ricoh, ElectroNeek provides best-in-class services including ultimate GTM support by vendors.

Role description

We’re looking for a Senior QA Test Automation Engineer on a full-time remote basis who will be working with Desktop and Web applications & latest emerging technologies. You will be reporting to the QA Manager and will be part of an international remote team.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze applications and systems; identify areas for test automation.
  • Investigate and define a proper approach to cover higher-risk scenarios with autotests.
  • Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
  • Implement test plans, automation, and validation strategies for Web applications and Services.
  • Autotests development, support, review, and documentation. Test data creation and maintenance.
  • Build exceptional, highly efficient practices for testing and integration of test automation to the software development life cycle.
  • Collaborate with Product Owners and Developers on tasks related to planning, testing, and coordination of release activities. Bugs reporting and follow-up.



Conditions:

  • A fully-remote, tech-enabled environment;
  • Mon-Fri 10 AM - 7 PM EST with flexibility;
  • Paid time off and vacation;
  • Stock Option Plan;
  • Commissions (Bonus);
  • An exceptionally tight-knit team of friendly colleagues;
  • Opportunity to work with an internationally multicultural distributed team.
Requirements
  • 5+ years of work experience in test automation positions.
  • Upper-Intermediate English (B2 Level minimum).
  • Experience in implementation from scratch of automation testing frameworks.
  • Deep understanding of different types of testing and theory of software quality assurance.
  • Knowledge of the different software development methodologies.
  • Familiar with at least two automation frameworks, such as PlayRight / Selenium / Karate / Spectron / TestComplete / Ranorex / Katalon / Cypress, etc.
  • Familiar with SQA and test management tools (JIRA, Wiki, Git, Zephyr Scale, Testrail, etc.)
  • Experience coding in TypeScript or JavaScript.
  • Knowledge of CI-CD tools such as Jenkins / Gitlab CI / Bitbucket Pipelines / GitHub Actions.
  • Experience in services testing (Postman/SoapUI, REST, JSON, XML).
  • Performance Test experience is a plus (JMeter, LoadRunner, others).

results.title: QA Automation Engineer - Mobile - Fintech
results.description:
About Tymit

At Tymit our mission is to give people the self-confidence to live life to the fullest by offering them credit that's smart, flexible and honest.

That's why we launched the world's first installment credit card – and why we're now partnering with only the most iconic brands to bring the next generation of installment experiences to their customers.

We believe that everyone deserves financial peace of mind, that credit should only work for you, and that tech will continue to transform the way to shop, pay and manage our spending.

Our talented and growing team is based in the UK, Spain and Greece, and we're all committed to creating a diverse, fun work environment, with collaboration and the customer at the core of everything we do.

Following our £23m Series A round, closed in October 2021 and led by Frasers Group, we're focused on our next phase of growth - and creating the future of installment experiences.

Compensation & Perks

💰 The salary range of this role is 35,000€ – 48,000€ per annum, depending on experience.

🏝 25 days of paid holiday plus bank holidays.

🥳 Your birthday off.

🏡 Tymit is working fully remote, and all employees can remain working from home if they want, traveling to our offices when agreed with the team.

🌇 If your preference is working from our office and working onsite with other Tymiteers, we have you covered with our offices - Postpandemic.

⏰ Flexible working hours.

🤓 Additional days to attend conferences and workshops related to technology and/or events related to Tymit’s industry and sector.

💲 Budget for remote home expenses.

📚 Learning & Development is a big asset for us, and we count with a yearly budget.

🏥 Private health insurance.

👩🏽‍🤝‍👩🏻 Referral program.

💳 6 months free-interest for all Tymiteers in our Tymit card.

💻 Budget for your home office set up.

About the role

We are looking for a talented and dedicated QA Engineer to build the safest credit card in the market. Our tech team is growing – and learning as we go. We’re on a journey, building and evolving the way we work, and we’re looking for recruits who can teach us as much as we’ll teach them.

Joining our engineering team, and you work cross-platform, testing on both our iOS and Android applications. We have a product-oriented team, releasing apps every week. The ideal candidate is mobile-savvy, loves testing, and understands what makes a great mobile app!

About the culture

Be ready to join a company where collaboration is key. You will be expected to share knowledge and speak up, at the same time you have the ability to listen to others and consider their opinions. At Tymit we are also big fans of good atmosphere and humor, prepare yourself to receive a bunch of GIFs.

QA Engineers at Tymit work by squads in cross-functional teams, applying good practices and agile methodologies. Within the team, you will find Angela, Sebas, Christos and Mariano.

During your time at Tymit you will

  • Work as part of cross-functional, friendly, agile tech teams to ensure quality is driven into the development process.
  • Test new features and ensure that existing features are working well.
  • Ensure that tests are executed and give regular feedback to the team on the status of quality.
  • Help to configure test environments for both manual and automated tests.
  • Find bugs and analyze the importance and priority of bugs relating to a release.
  • Write clear bug reports and provide all the necessary detail so that others can reproduce and diagnose the issue.
  • Play a part in clarifying business requirements and user stories.
  • Work with Product, Tech, and Ops teams to ensure applications are tested to the defined acceptance level.
  • Bear in mind both verification and validation for the product.
  • Collaborate on the definition of process. Actively provides improvement feedback on current processes.
  • Push improvement for automation across the testing pyramid.
  • Consider best practices, design patterns, code smells for the automation code and the reviews.
  • Instructs, mentors and coaches to develop a QA mindset to other QAs and tech roles.
  • Collaborate in the metric definition and implementation.

Key technologies we use at Tymit

Software Engineer in Test team: you will be working with technologies such as Xcode, Android Studio, JMeter, Xray, Appium, Selenium, TestProject, Taurus, Slack and Jira.

Tymit tech team: we work with technologies such as Kotlin, SwiftUI, Swift, Java, Groovy, Grails, Quarkus, NodeJS, React, Python, RabbitMQ, Postgres, AWS, ELK, Docker, Docker Swarm, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins.

We are always open to adopting new tools to solve complex problems, so we’re ready to discuss options with anyone with the right experience.

Know your path within Tymit...

1 month

Taking off!

You will meet other Tymiteers and their roles in the guild and squad, looking at the tools, processes, ceremonies, stack, stakeholders, etc. Also, where to find out the documentation and what are the development processes with all its conventions. Start participating in the team culture and the recurring meetings of the QA team and squad, such as retros, syncs, and internal learning sessions, so you get familiar with the format.

You will be able to start pulling the thread, looking at possible improvements and things you may want to take on later. You will understand the scale and impact of our business.

3 months

Dig in!

You will have ventured into all squads and worked cross-functionally with Product Managers, Engineers, and Designers enough to understand requirements, provide technical insights. You will be familiar enough with the structure of our project to be able to start proposing improvements. Do manual test across different layers, define test plans, define test cases, start identifying risks.

6 months

Push up!

You will be a crucial member of the team. So, your contributions and proposals will bring tremendous value to the business and help other more junior team members grow. You will have a vision of the roadmap and the priorities to make Tymit’s tech scalable. You will be working with the broader engineering team to enhance, document, establish processes and improve the app's design and functionalities. Coordinates the execution of test sessions, detect and rise risks during the SDLC, collaborates on the definition of process, drive POCs for automation initiatives.

What you will bring along

  • Hands-on experience in testing mobile apps.
  • Previous experience using Xcode/Android studio, Espresso, Charles Proxy, or any other proxy tool.

What you can expect from our hiring process

So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background.

results.title: Senior QA (m/f/d)
results.description:
About DECA Games

DECA specializes in acquiring games from other developers and reinvigorating them to continue to entertain for decades. About our culture

Employees are trusted to manage their time and get things done independently. We believe that egos and politics need to be checked at the virtual door. That means no jerks are allowed, that no job is too small for anyone, and an openness to help and learn from each other is required. We love the challenge of working within constraints and love when we succeed as a team. Check out more about us and our values on our website (www.decagames.com) 

About the role

We are looking for a Senior QA Tester with strong experience in GAAS and Live Operations QA field  to work with our multi talented team to ensure the delivery of high quality products to our customers. Core hours are 9am to 6pm CET, fully remote, 5 days a week, working weekends when required along with compensation days off during the weekdays

Working together with the rest of the QA team, development department as well as the various stakeholders, you will have the opportunity to understand all the internal dynamics and impact the way we build our product processes.

results.title: QA Engineer
results.description:
About Us

Close is a bootstrapped, profitable, 100% remote, ~70 person team of thoughtful individuals who value autonomy and impact. We’re eager to make a product our customers fall in love with over and over again.

 

We ❤️ startups & SMBs. Since 2013, we’ve been building a CRM  that focuses on better communication, without the hassle of manual data entry or complex UI. Our goal: double the productivity of every sales rep.

 

Our app’s frontend is a single-page JavaScript/TypeScript web app mostly written in React. Our mobile app is built using React Native. Our backend tech stack consists of Python/Flask, MongoDB, Postgres, Elasticsearch, and Redis, and communicates with clients via our REST API & GraphQL endpoints. We run our services in Docker on AWS.

 

We care about performance, maintainability, and testability of our code. Writing unit/integration tests is embedded into our engineering culture. We test more complex features end-to-end via Cypress. We also house lists of manual test steps to follow for testing critical features like calling and composing emails. Our focus is on testing actual user behavior, leveraging the Testing Library approach.

 

Our product development process is inspired by Shape Up. We sweat the UI/UX details and work collaboratively with the Product team throughout the design process. We think about testing in the technical specification phase and we continuously spend time assuring we’re shipping a high-quality product.

 

We open source our code and ideas on our GitHub and on The Making of Close, our behind-the-scenes Product & Engineering blog. Check out our projects like TaskTiger and use-infinite-scroll or insights from our day-to-day work such as Rendering untrusted HTML email, safely, How We Improved Reliability Of Our WebSocket Connections, and A Case Study in"Reactizing" a Complex Backbone View.

 

 

About You

We're looking for an experienced full-time individual to join us as the 1st QA Engineer on our team. Someone who has a solid understanding of web technologies and real world user behavior and wants to help test, QA, and launch major user-facing features. You'd enjoy an opportunity to lead the way on the QA front and help us establish best practices for testing/QA and help us improve the quality of our product.

 

You should have at least 2 years of experience with testing/QA of user-facing behavior. You have a brain for breaking things. You are detail-oriented and thorough when writing down test plans and when opening high-quality bug reports. You deeply care about the quality of a product.

 

You’re comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team where you're supported in your efforts to grow professionally. You are able to manage your time well, communicate effectively, and collaborate with a fully distributed team.

 

You are located in an American, European or African time zone.

 

We are open to hiring junior, mid, and senior level QA Engineers for this role.

About the job

  • You’ll be reporting to our Sr. Frontend Engineering Manager and you’ll be working closely with the Frontend, Backend, Product Management, and Design teams.
  • Help us improve the quality of what we’re shipping, reducing amount of bugs/regressions.
  • Help us test features as they are being built/reviewed, and keep an eye on recently shipped code for potential issues.
  • Primarily you'll focus on testing/QA of user-facing behavior and creating high quality issues (bug reports) based on testing our in-product UI across web, desktop, and mobile.
  • Additionally you'll test against our API and consider ways our customers may hit issues in their integrations or with Zapier.
  • Help us improve how we’re doing automated testing (unit, E2E, etc.).
  • Help Dev teams find ways to improve their testing strategies.

 

Bonus points if you have...

  • Experience in contributing to tests in JavaScript via React Testing Library/Cypress/Playwright
  • Experience testing GraphQL and Websockets endpoints
  • Worked with B2B SaaS products
  • Experience with sales or sales tools

 

Come help us with projects like...

  • Modern Rich Text Editor with collaboration features
  • Workflow Automation
  • Web-based calling
  • Responsive mobile web & native mobile app


Why work with us?

  • Our culture 💚
  • 100% remote company (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • Choose between working 5 days/wk (standard full-time) or 4 days/wk @ 80% pay
  • Annual team retreats ✈️
  • Quarterly virtual summits
  • 5 weeks PTO + Winter Holiday Break
  • 2 additional PTO days every year with the company
  • 1 month paid sabbatical every 5 years
  • Co-working stipend
  • Paid parental leave
  • Medical, Dental, Vision with HSA option (US residents)
  • 401k matching at 6% (US residents)
  • Dependent care FSA (US residents)
  • Contributor to Stripe's climate initiative 🌍❤️ 
  • Our story and team 🚀


Our values

  • Build a house you want to live in -- Examine long-term thinking and action
  • No BS -- Practice transparency and honesty, especially when it’s hard
  • Invest in each other -- Build successful relationships with your coworkers and customers 
  • Discipline equals freedom -- Keep your word to yourself and others
  • Strive for greatness -- Constantly challenge yourself and others 


How we work together

  • Productivity, Quality & Impact: We don’t track hours. We trust you’re an adult and know best how to prioritize, meet your goals and contribute at a high level. 
  • Asynchronous communication & collaboration: We have team members all over the world. We don’t expect anyone to work untraditional hours, that means our default is async. Most teams have 2-5 hours of internal meetings weekly. 
  • Appreciation for Deep Work: *During your normal work day, not after a day a meetings*. 
  • Autonomy & Freedom: Create a work environment that is sustainable for you. We place a high amount of trust and responsibility with our team members from the start. 


At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practice a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our business - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).  

 

We come from 20+ countries located in 5 of the 7 continents. We’re a collection of talented humans, rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Every year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. These gatherings are an opportunity to strengthen the relationships within our global community.

 

Our team is growing in more ways than one - in the last few years, we've launched 24 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our people and help our customers become more successful. 

 

Our application process was designed to promote equitable and unbiased hiring practices. We ask a small series of questions that are similar to what would be asked in the first interview. This helps us learn more about you right from the start so please be sure to answer each question thoughtfully. Each application will receive two screens by two different reviewers. Regardless of fit, you will hear back from us letting you know if we'll be moving forward.

results.title: Director of Quality Assurance
results.description:
Sightline Payment is seeking an experienced Director of Quality Assurance to join our team to lead the Quality Assurance department, manage third party relationships and contractors, and build an automation test framework. This role reports to the SVP of the Project Management Office. You will establish good testing practices, be responsible for manual and automated testing and mentoring others with the QA team. Success in this role requires the spirit of collaboration, clear communication, and the ability to maintain a strategic focus amidst competing priorities. The ideal candidate will thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous start- up environments.

This role is offering a base salary in the range of $118,000-$130,000, depending on experience. The top end of the range will be reserved for those applicants with gaming and casino operations experience. There is the potential to earn up to an additional 20% annually in bonus. Our benefits start on the 1st of the month after the start date and include unlimited PTO, up to a 3% match on 401K contributions, paid parental leave, and a robust health benefits package.


Here is an idea of some of the day to day duties of the role:

  • Hires and trains QA staff.
  • Oversees the daily workflow and schedules of the department including the management of external third-party partnerships.
  • Evaluates external resources and solutions where applicable and makes appropriate recommendations to PMO leadership.
  • Investigate, recommend, implement, and manage automated testing platform and supporting tools.
  • Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
  • Handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy.
  • Represent the QA department to senior management and champion QA best practices in accordance to the company's SDLC processes.
  • Utilize basic statistical tools (e.g., SPC, variation, stability, control) to analyze for trends or issues.
  • Prepare any required reporting documentation for the respective testing activities.
  • Ensures test cases are traceable to originating story/requirement and those tests fully test feature requirements and/or user story acceptance criteria.
  • Drive efficiencies in the QA process and mentor other QA team members in automation
  • Collaborate with lead developers, unit testing engineer, and business analysts to develop, design and execute automated test scripts and scenarios
  • Develops, implements, and manages processes to ensure that products meet required specifications for quality, function, and reliability prior to delivery.
  • Identifies and sets appropriate quality standards and parameters for products.
  • Communicates quality standards and parameters to QA team, product development team, and other appropriate staff.
  • Orchestrates product testing processes and ensures testing environments are maintained and are simulating production.
  • Identifies and analyzes issues, bugs, defects, and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple products; recommends and facilitates solutions to these issues.
  • Establishes and maintains cadence with development to set testing expectations.
  • Reviews client, customer, and user feedback.
  • Maintains compliance with federal, state, local, and organizational laws, regulations, guidelines, and policies.


Here is an idea of some of the experience you'll need to have to be considered for the role:

  • 5+ years managing a QA team
  • Experience working with third party service providers and contract employees
  • College Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Gaming or payment industry experience a plus
  • 2+ years Web and Mobile application development testing experience
  • 5+ years of experience developing test automation framework using Selenium or similar tools
  • 2+ years with API testing with Postman or GET
  • Experience with Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, CI/CD, Java, C#, BrowserStack
  • Highly adaptable to a changing environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Additional QA certifications
  • Azure Dev Ops and experience implementing and executing the Test Plans Module

Sightline Payments is the recognized industry leader in innovative cashless gaming solutions and has placed multiple programs supporting gaming verticals in the United States. Our Play+ solution offers players a truly cashless gaming experience with complete flexibility for how manage and spend their funds. We offer flexible integration choices to meet our client’s operating environment and preferred user experience, support communications with multiple gaming systems, and manage all aspects of our program from conception to ongoing program success. We are rapidly growing company that is positioned to meet the challenges of an evolving gaming ecosystem market.

Our environment is entrepreneurial and fast-paced. Individual and creative contributions to our company objectives are highly encouraged and recognized. There will be an abundance of opportunities to develop new skills and to benefit from interaction with a highly experienced leadership team.

results.title: Junior QA Analyst - WTFast
results.description:

  • Work Remotely

  • Strong problem-solving, decision-making and critical thinking skills
  • Open-minded, positive and keen to learn
  • Knowledge of VoIP technologies and protocols is a plus

  • Great team player

Our Tech Stack:

Why you will love to be a CloudTalker:

results.title: QA Tester
results.description:
Hi 👋  I’m Sylvie, and I lead QA at Ashby. As our team and customer base grow, we are looking for the next QA Tester to join our team and continue building an excellent QA process together. We strive to automate most of the mundane parts of QA testing, and currently use a mix of manual and automated testing. 

 

Collaborating with the engineering team in releasing exciting new features, and investigating bugs for the customer support team are our main priorities. One of the best parts of my job is building trusting relationships with our engineers, and feeling like I have a direct impact on making our product not only usable for our customers but beloved by them!

 

You might be the perfect match for our team if:

  • You are detail-oriented and are an excellent communicator - someone who is committed to creating great collaborations with engineers and customer service

  • You are terrific at time management and taking initiative, being able to think outside of the box to find solutions

  • You can scale up your knowledge of the Ashby product systematically and document workflows for easily reproducible QA. You love to learn!

  • You are passionate about the customer experience and ensuring it’s constantly exceeding expectations.

Bonus

  • You have experience working with a complex and technical product

  • You are familiar with automation and creating automated tests

  • You can use SQL and similarly advanced methods for debugging

 

What We’re Building

At Ashby, we’re improving the productivity of working professionals (starting with talent teams) with intelligent and powerful software. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered and extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.

 

We have many customers who love us, and we have great investors like YCombinator, Elad Gil, and Lachy Groom. I’ll share more once we meet.

 

Our Culture

Our team culture is motivated by Abhik and Benji’s (our co-founders) belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast (and work regular hours!).

 

Collaboration is Natural, Communication is Deliberate

Our team consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind (meet them here!). These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is sacred, and individual contributors have less than 2 hours of meetings per week (Abhik wrote about it here). 

 

Give Ownership & Autonomy

Our culture reflects the experience of having a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution: individual contributors, including engineers, own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don’t get to practice, and, at Ashby, we provide mentorship to grow them and help from the team where you want it. 

 

Put Effort into Diversity 

Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. Having built my career as a woman in non-diverse fields, I am fully invested in making sure Ashby creates opportunities for individuals from underrepresented groups.

 

Today, 39% of Ashby identifies as women or non-binary, 10% from underrepresented ethnic groups in tech. It’s not great, and we are taking conscious steps to improve, like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous paid family leave, and more.

 

Interview Process

At Ashby, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We’ll dive into past projects and get an idea of your approach to QA by having you record a QA process for part of our product. Our interview process is three rounds:

 

  • 45-minute introduction call

  • A take-home assignment where you will document a QA workflow (4 hours max)

  • A meeting with a cofounder (30 minutes)

  • A virtual on-site of 2 hours and 30 minutes (can be split across two days)

 

Your hiring manager will be your main point of contact and prep you for interviews. You can get a product demo as early as the introductory call. During the interview process, you’ll meet a co-founder plus 4 to 6 people in engineering (with 15 minutes in each interview to ask them questions). If we don’t give an offer, we’ll provide feedback!

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity.

  • 10-year exercise window for stock options. You shouldn’t feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby —do it when you feel financially comfortable.

  • Unlimited PTO with four weeks recommended per year. Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it 😅.

  • Twelve weeks of fully paid family leave in the US. We plan to expand this to employees in other countries as situations arise.

  • Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive!

  • $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval.

  • If you’re in the US, top-notch health insurance for you and your dependents with all premiums covered by us.

 

Ashby’s success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We’re being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.




Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

results.title: Senior Software Developer In Test
results.description:
About us:  
D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software, and services and is the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling.    
 
D-Wave’s systems and quantum cloud services are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. We have also appeared in Time Magazine, MIT Technology Review, Forbes, INC Magazine and Wired.     
 
As of August 8, 2022, our organization is a publicly traded quantum computing company, trading on the NYSE as ($QBTS). 
 
About the role:  
D-Wave’s Test Engineering team is seeking a Senior Software Developer in Test! In this role, you will be on a team of highly motivated software developers working with our software, applications and DevOps teams to test, automate, monitor, deploy and advance our state-of-the-art hybrid and quantum computing service.  
 
Your primary focus will be the Leap cloud platform and hybrid solver service with aspects of manual and automated test development, performance testing, test ops, and CI/CD automation. You will collaborate on the entire development process end-to-end from technical requirements review, and development, through implementation) along with enhancing our sophisticated test automation infrastructure.
 
You will have the opportunity to influence the future of our products and get exposure to a full quantum computing stack from the client side all the way through to the classical systems driving the QPU.   



What you'll do:
  • Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases 
  • Design, develop and implement automated test cases and test infrastructure for validating existing and new features 
  • Review and translate customer/business/product requirements and product goals into appropriate end-to-end and functional tests 
  • Maintain acceptable code coverage through automated regression tests 
  • Report, monitor and track the resolution of defects 
  • Design, implement, and operate our deployment pipelines for cloud systems  
  • Use your experience and expertise to provide architectural and design guidance to our development teams for our cloud services  
  • Work with the software development and DevOps teams to streamline our build processes and release management via continuous integration and deployment pipelines  
  • Take ownership and participate in root-cause analysis of production incidents 
  • Continuously monitor and improve the performance and reliability of regression test suites 



What you'll bring:
  • A degree in Computing Science, Engineering or equivalent education and experience 
  • 3+ years of professional experience in UI test automation/quality assurance or software development role 
  • 3+ years of professional experience developing automated test cases  
  • 2+ years of related programming experience in Python, Ruby, Groovy, Go, or a comparable language including specifically working with 3rd party REST APIs  
  • A methodical approach and a good eye for detail 
  • Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, collaborative team 
  • Knowledge of modern software testing methodologies, OOP, tools and processes 
  • Aptitude towards designing and architecting high-quality, reliable software test assets including test design, approach, scripts and bugs 
  • Experience in an Agile Environment 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills - you like to document your work! 



Bonus points for:
  • Experience in architecting, configuring, deploying, operating, and troubleshooting modern SaaS/PaaS web applications and environments on a major cloud platform  
  • Experience with monitoring systems such as Kibana, Grafana 
  • Expert in source code control, managing artifacts, configuration management / configuration as code, CI/CD pipelines, etc. e.g. Git, Terraform, Docker, Jenkins, Spinnaker, or their equivalents  
Additional information:  
We celebrate diverse perspectives to drive innovation in our pursuit. Our employees range from distinguished domain experts with decades of experience in their respective fields, to bright and motivated graduates eager to make their mark.  
 
Our diverse and innovative team will make you feel appreciated, supported and empower your career growth at D-Wave.    
 
No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.
 
It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.
